summary.Title: Head of Secretariat - The Indo-Danish Centre of Excellence for Offshore Wind and Renewable Energy

JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Head of Secretariat - The Indo-Danish Centre of Excellence for Offshore Wind and Renewable Energy
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Danish Energy Agency and Danida are seeking a Long-term Energy Adviser (N1) in India to serve as Head of Secretariat of the Centre of Excellence for Offshore Wind and Renewable Energy.

The Centre of Excellence is part of the India-Denmark Energy Partnership. Since 2018, India and Denmark have collaborated on the establishment of the Indian offshore wind sector. On 9th September 2021, the Honourable Minister R.K. Singh and Honourable Minister Dan Jørgensen inaugurated the Centre of Excellence for Offshore Wind and Renewable Energy in Delhi. The vision of the Centre is to become a respected and leading non-profit knowledge hub working for the rapid development of offshore wind energy in India. Read more about the Centre here.

As Head of Secretariat, you will lead the activities of the Centre, provide technical advice, and share knowledge to the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) and its implementing agencies, in order to contribute to a fruitful and trust-based cooperation between the partners and the Danish Energy Agency.

You will be based in New Delhi and working closely with your Indian colleagues, and bridging to the Danish Energy Agency, which is responsible for the implementation and administration of India-Denmark Energy Partnership.

You have a solid knowledge of Global offshore wind energy polices and sector, a relevant university education and extensive experience working with one or more fields related to offshore wind energy, as well as broad knowledge of the Danish energy landscape. Knowledge of India’s power sector and culture will also be an advantage. Your English is fluent. Your assignment will be in New Delhi and expire by the 31st of December 2024.

You can read more about the job profile here.

Staff regulations for long-term advisers can be found here.

Application deadline: Sunday, May 29 2022

details.FormattedPurpose:
The Danish Energy Agency and Danida are seeking a Long-term Energy Adviser (N1) in India to serve as Head of Secretariat of the Centre of Excellence for Offshore Wind and Renewable Energy.

The Centre of Excellence is part of the India-Denmark Energy Partnership. Since 2018, India and Denmark have collaborated on the establishment of the Indian offshore wind sector. On 9th September 2021, the Honourable Minister R.K. Singh and Honourable Minister Dan Jørgensen inaugurated the Centre of Excellence for Offshore Wind and Renewable Energy in Delhi. As Head of Secretariat, you will lead the activities of the Centre, provide technical advice, and share knowledge to the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) and its implementing agencies, in order to contribute to a fruitful and trust-based cooperation between the partners and the Danish Energy Agency.

You have a solid knowledge of Global offshore wind energy polices and sector, a relevant university education and extensive experience working with one or more fields related to offshore wind energy, as well as broad knowledge of the Danish energy landscape. Knowledge of India’s power sector and culture will also be an advantage. Your English is fluent. Your assignment will be in New Delhi and expire by the 31st of December 2024.

You can read more about the job profile here.

Staff regulations for long-term advisers can be found here.

Application deadline: Sunday, May 29 2022
